home.title: Autobahn Solo Helper
home.play1: Play against Autobot, the Solo Mode opponent of Autobahn.
home.play2: This helper application replaces the task and action card decks of Autobot and manages the difficulty levels.

difficultyLevel.title: Difficulty Level
difficultyLevel.increaseDifficulty1: Autobot's Trucks move 1 additional space every turn
difficultyLevel.increaseDifficulty2: Autobot gets 1 Development Track step each time one of your Trucks drive past one of its Service Stations
difficultyLevel.increaseDifficulty3: Autobot moves on the Development Track if it skips its turn
difficultyLevel.increaseDifficulty4: Autobot gains more promotions at the end of each era (1/1/2)
difficultyLevel.increaseDifficulty5: Autobot gains more promotions at the end of each era (1/2/2)

setupAutobot.title: Prepare Autobot
setupAutobot.twoPlayers: Set up the game for 2 players.
setupAutobot.pickPlayerColor: Pick a player color for Autobot. Autobot uses the 25 Employees, 8 Service Stations, 1 Development token of that player color. Instead of taking a Truck for that color, Autobot takes 1 Truck and 1 Development token in each of the other, unused colors.
setupAutobot.setupAutobotComponents: Set up Autobot's components and play area as follows:
setupAutobot.placeSoloBoard: Place the {soloBoard} in Autobot's play area.
setupAutobot.chooseDeliveryBoard: Randomly choose a Delivery board for Autobot and place it next to the Solo board.
setupAutobot.placeEmployees: Place Autobot's 25 Employees beside the Solo board.
setupAutobot.placeServiceStations: Place Autobot's 8 Service Stations on the appropriate spaces of the Solo board.
setupAutobot.placeDevelopmentToken: Place Autobot's Development token on the first space of the Development Track.
setupAutobot.placeBlackConstructionOffice: Autobot is the start player, so place 1 of Autobot's Employees onto the first (leftmost) seat of the black Construction Office. Place one of yours on the next seat.
setupAutobot.setupPlayerPlayArea: Set up your play area as normal, and reveal 2 Route cards from the deck. Pick one for yourself and discard the other one. Return the unused route cards back to the box. Autobot does not have a Route card.
setupAutobot.winePickCard: Wine Module: You randomly pick one of the wine cards for yourself, and place the remaining three next to the solo board.
setupAutobot.unlimitedBudget: Autobot has an unlimited budget. You do not need to track Autobot's income or expenditure.

turnBot.title: Autobot's turn
turnBot.turnSkipInfo: Autobot has no viable action in his whole task card deck and will skip this turn.

botGainBonus.title: Autobot Gain Bonus
botGainBonus.discard: Discard: Autobot discards an action card from the display. Once selected, slide all remaining cards to the right and draw a new card to place in the leftmost slot. Priority for discarding a card:
botGainBonus.discardPrioItem1: The leftmost card of the current color.
botGainBonus.discardPrioItem2: The rightmost card of the color which appears most in the display.
botGainBonus.develop: Develop: Move Autobot's Marker 1 or 2 steps forward on the Development Track.
botGainBonus.advancedCard: Take Advanced Task Card: Add an advanced card to the task card deck.
botGainBonus.promote: Promote: Promote 1 of Autobot's Employees as explained in Autobot's promotions.
botGainBonus.colorCard: Take Color Card: Take the leftmost card from the display. This will give Autobot an extra color card.
botGainBonus.promoteServiceTrade: Promote: Promotions gained in this way should be taken on the Department shown if possible. If a promotion in the department shown is not possible, follow the normal priority rules in Autobot's promotions.
botGainBonus.buildServiceStation: Build a Service Station: Immediately perform the Build a Service Station action.
botGainBonus.buildRoadSection: Build a road section: Immediately perform the Build a road section action.
botGainBonus.upgradeLink: Upgrade a link: Immediately perform the Upgrade a link action.
botGainBonus.placeEmployee: Place an Employee: Autobot places an Employee in the Office that matches the current color.
botGainBonus.promotionInfo1: Autobot's promotions are limited depending on which era it is. During the first era, Autobot's Employees may only be promoted as high as the 1st floor. During the second era, they may only be promoted as high as the 2nd floor. In the third era, Autobot's Employees may access any floor. This limitation rule also applies to Autobot's Employees when they are promoted during the end of era steps.
botGainBonus.promotionInfo2: Unless the bonus shows a particular Department, when Autobot gains a promotion, it will promote whichever Employee can reach the highest floor in any Department. If two or more Employees can reach equally high floors, the Employee in the leftmost Department is promoted.

buildRoadUpgradeLink.title: Build Road Section or Upgrade Link

buildRoad.title: Build Road Section
buildRoad.intro: Autobot builds the next road section of the autobahn that matches the current color. If all available road sections have already been built, Autobot will instead upgrade a complete link.

priority.title: Priority:
priority.item1: The section of road that would allow one of Autobot's Trucks to deliver a Goods token to or move towards its destination country. If tied, the country that appears highest on Autobot's delivery board.
priority.item2: A section of road that contains a Bonus token.
priority.item3: The section of road nearest to the black autobahn (the fewest road sections to travel).
priority.item4: In the first and second eras, the southernmost location, then the westernmost. In the third era, the northernmost location, then the easternmost.

buildRoad.employeeCostInfo: When building a road, Autobot places an Employee in the corresponding Office as usual. Autobot never pays building costs.

upgradeLink.title: Upgrade Link
upgradeLink.intro: If all road sections are built, Autobot will instead upgrade a complete link.

priority.title: Priority:
priority.item1: The section of road nearest to the black autobahn (the fewest roads spaces to travel).
priority.item3: In the first and second eras, the southernmost location, then the westernmost. In the third era, the northernmost location, then the easternmost.

upgradeLink.employeeCostInfo: When upgrading a road, Autobot places an Employee in the corresponding Office as usual. Autobot never pays upgrading costs.

loadTruck.title: Load Truck
loadTruck.intro1: When Autobot takes the â€˜Load Truck' action it will select a destination country to deliver to and a depot to load goods at.
loadTruck.intro2: When selecting a country to deliver to, Autobot selects a country to which it has not yet delivered and is not currently delivering. In the first and second era, Autobot ignores Poland and Czech Republic.
loadTruck.intro3: Autobot will select a country on Autobot's delivery board that pairs with the loaded good type.
loadTruck.intro4: If there is not an undelivered to country that pairs with the current good type, Autobot cannot take this main action, so place the card aside in the Task queue.
loadTruck.intro5: Autobot always has the ability to use both of its Trucks. If no Truck is available Autobot cannot take this main action, so place the card aside in the Task queue.

loadNonBlack.title: Loading on the red, cyan, purple, orange or white roads
loadNonBlack.info: Choose the depot that matches the current color and load that Goods token. Place the Goods token on an available Truck and place the Truck in the depot.

loadBlack.title: Loading on the black road
loadBlack.info: If the current color is black, Autobot selects the delivery country first, then selects the good type shown on its delivery board for that country. Once the country is selected, Autobot will choose the Goods token that matches that country on Autobot's delivery board. Place the Goods token on an available Truck and place the Truck in the depot. If Automotive goods or Chemicals are selected choose the depot nearest the delivery location.

priority.title: Priority for selecting a country:
priority.item1: A country connected to the network.
priority.item2: A country that contains a Bonus token.
priority.item3: A country with the fewest road sections left to be built.
priority.item4: The uppermost country shown on Autobot's delivery board.

loadTruck.developmentToken: Place the development token that matches the color of the Truck Autobot has loaded on the board beside the selected country. This marks the selected country for that Truck.

loadingPharmaceuticals.title: Loading Pharmaceuticals
loadingPharmaceuticals.info: During the third era, if the current color is cyan or yellow, Autobot selects Pharmaceuticals to load (instead of Automotive goods). Instead of the usual criteria, Autobot selects a connected country to which Pharmaceuticals have not yet been delivered, starting with Austria (Wien) and going clockwise around the map. If the player delivers pharmaceuticals to the selected country before Autobot, move the development token to the next connected country to which Pharmaceuticals have not yet been delivered, in clockwise order. When delivered, Autobot gains the Pharmaceuticals delivery bonus as normal.

buildServiceStation.title: Build Service Station
buildServiceStation.intro: Autobot builds a Service Station on the next available Service Station space on the autobahn that matches the current color.

priority.title: Priority:
priority.item1: The Service Station space nearest to the black autobahn (the fewest road sections to travel).
priority.item2: In the first and second eras, the southernmost location, then the westernmost. In the third era, the northernmost location, then the easternmost.
priority.item3: If building on a black Service Station space, pick the closest to Bad Hersfeld, with ties broken in the first and second eras by the southernmost location, and in the third era, by the northernmost location.

buildServiceStation.noViableSpace: If there are no connected Service Station spaces that match the current color, the action is not viable.
buildServiceStation.era3Info: As usual, Service Stations cannot be built in East Germany during the first and second eras.
buildServiceStation.gainBonus: When placing a Service Station, Autobot immediately gains the bonus depicted underneath it on the Solo board as described in Autobot's Gain Bonus.

takeAdvancedCard.title: Take Advanced Card
takeAdvancedCard.addCardInfo: This will add an advanced card to the bot's task card deck.

takeColorCard.title: Take Color Card
takeColorCard.pickColors: Please select the colors of the leftmost card from the display here, and discard it afterwards from the display.
takeColorCard.pickAction: Please check if the color card has a Build Road action on it.
